bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from M. A. Roberts to Laura Armistead Carter, March 8, 1929

div1.p: Roberts informs Carter that according to Library of Congress records, her borrowing privileges have ended and asks for the return of certain volumes.

div1.head: Letter from M. A. Roberts to Laura Armistead Carter, March 8, 1929
div1.opener:
AW
OFFICE OF THE SUPERINTENDENT
LIBRARY OF CONGRESS
READING ROOM
WASHINGTON
Book, Misel.
Library of Congress
March 8, 1929
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
My attention is directed to the fact that the undermentioned*
books have been drawn by you, although the permit to draw books, is-
sued in your favor expired December 31, 192[unclear]8.

We should like to have the overdue volumes returned-doubt-
less this matter has escaped your notice. Should you desire an
extension of your permit, a request to that effect would receive atten-
tion.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, M.A. Roberts M. A. Roberts
Superintendent of Reading Room
Feb. 20, 1929
Brinton Maya chronicles
Feb. 13, 1929
Oviedo y Baldes: Historia Gen....Las Indias, v. 2-3
Feb. 6, 1929
Casas Historia de las Indias
Nov. 3, 1928
Hakluyt Society Publication v. 92. Les Africanus.
Miss Laura A. Carter,
The Westmoreland,
2122 California Street, N.W.,
Washington D.C.
N. B. This letter received (cf. envelope attached)
and answered Feb. 13/29 (a. m.)
L. A. C.
